headline: Berkshire Hathaway’s CEO Suggests These 4 Companies Are Forever Stocks
summary: Greg Abel identified four large Berkshire equity investments—Apple, American Express, Coca Cola and Moody’s—and suggested they are forever stocks, or close to it.

raw.headline: Berkshire Hathaway’s CEO Suggests These 4 Companies Are Forever Stocks

headline: Use This ETF to Earn Dividends From Berkshire Hathaway
summary: Berkshire Hathaway doesn't pay a dividend, but investors can get one and exposure to the stock with this ETF.

headline: Greg Abel as Berkshire Earnings Fall: 'Warren Is Obviously a Very Hard Act To Follow'
summary: Greg Abel, calling Warren Buffett "a very hard act to follow," signaled continuity at Berkshire as Q4 operating earnings fell about 30% and the cash hoard dipped despite no buybacks.

raw.headline: Greg Abel as Berkshire Earnings Fall: 'Warren Is Obviously a Very Hard Act To Follow'
raw.summary: Greg Abel, calling Warren Buffett "a very hard act to follow," signaled continuity at Berkshire as Q4 operating earnings fell about 30% and the cash hoard dipped despite no buybacks.

headline: Coca-Cola Extends Powerade To India As Dividends And Valuation Under Review
summary: Coca-Cola (NYSE:KO) is launching Powerade in India for the first time as the official sports drink of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup. The company is marking its 64th consecutive annual dividend increase. Coca-Cola has appointed Todd Beiger as the new Vice President and Head of Investor Relations. Coca-Cola, trading at $81.56, is layering these announcements onto a period of solid share price performance, with the stock up 2.2% over the past week and 11.6% over the past month. Over longer...

headline: AI “factor flip”: Why Wall Street is dumping tech quality for traditional value
summary: The quantitative strategies that have governed trillions of dollars in global capital are facing a historic identity crisis. As artificial intelligence reshapes the economic landscape, long-held definitions of "safe" and "expensive" stocks are being turned upside down.

raw.headline: AI “factor flip”: Why Wall Street is dumping tech quality for traditional value
raw.summary: The quantitative strategies that have governed trillions of dollars in global capital are facing a historic identity crisis. As artificial intelligence reshapes the economic landscape, long-held definitions of "safe" and "expensive" stocks are being turned upside down.
